title: A Challenge

en: Hey, I need to talk to you. I looked into how much money you made last month... and then looked over your general business plan.
I know I was going to let you do your own thing, but this is crazy. We're a partnership, and I can't help but feel like you're putting us in danger. There's no way this is going to be sustainable.
Still, I know this means a lot to you. Even if I want you to stop, that isn't fair of me to ask either. So, I have a proposition.
If you can make enough money to cover rent and expenses this month and next, with a little extra - say $2000 - I'll be quiet and trust your decisions from now on.
But if you can't make that happen, then I don't think this is going to work out for me.

no_caption: I probably can do that, but I should set my own challenges for me. Whatever.

en: Okay. Thank you for being okay with this. It's just so risky. You know how my mom is - always chasing some money-making scheme...
This is a little out of my comfort zone, quite honestly. Hopefully this will help me not to freak out.
If you cannot, or will not, 'make bank'...
skylar::I don't know what will happen. I don't want to force you to give up your dream, but I just - I can't live with this kind of insecurity.
